content.instruction:
Public goods have two unique characteristics:

  • non-rival consumption
  • non-exclusive ownership

hotspots.hotspot:
Non-rival consumption

Non-rival consumption means that one person's use of the good does not prevent another person from using the same good. If you are watching a fireworks show with your friend, your viewing does not prevent your friend from also seeing the fireworks.

Non-exclusive ownership

Non-exclusive ownership means that after a good is provided, it is difficult or impossible to keep those who have not paid from receiving the product. If your town charges admission to the park for a fireworks show, it cannot prevent people outside the park from looking into the sky to see the show.

multiple.question: Why must the government provide public goods?

answers.answer: A free-rider problem develops with such goods because people can obtain them without paying.
Profits of private firms would be too high if they provided such goods.
Consumers do not trust the quality of such goods when private firms produce them.
Private firms create negative externalities in the production of such products.
Private firms would charge too much for such goods.

multiple.question: A factory dumping pollution into the local river is an example of

answers.answer: a public good.
a positive externality.
an incentive.
an opportunity cost.
a negative externality.

multiple.question: The market fails in the case of a negative externality because the firm

answers.answer: is able to impose part of its costs on a third party.
cannot earn a profit in the market.
charges a price that is too high for the market.
cannot prevent those who don't pay from receiving the good.
produces too few products to achieve an efficient output.

multiple.question: The government can resolve positive externalities by

answers.answer: imposing a tax on the product.
limiting the number of products the firm can produce.
regulating the amount of the externality the firm can produce.
subsidizing the purchase of the product.
fining firms that produce the product.

multiple.question: The market fails for public goods because such goods have the characteristics of

answers.answer: virtually unlimited demand but very little supply.
non-rival consumption and non-exclusive ownership.
negative externality and scarcity.
opportunity cost and marginal revenue.
positive externality and a large private supply.

multiple.question:
Government solves the "free rider" problem of
public goods by

answers.answer: imposing fines and prison terms on people who use public goods.
ordering private firms to produce the public goods for a minimal cost.
providing the public goods and collecting taxes to pay for them.
rationing the amount of public goods each household can consume per year.
fining private firms that produce public goods.
